column4: Microsoft tops $1 trillion as it predicts more cloud growth
column5: Microsoft Corp on Wednesday briefly topped $1 trillion in value for the first time after executives predicted continued growth for its cloud computing business.

column4: UPDATE 4-Microsoft tops $1 trillion as it predicts more cloud growth
column5: April 24 Microsoft Corp on Wednesday briefly topped $1 trillion in value for the first time after executives predicted continued growth for its cloud computing business.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall Street edges lower  energy stocks fall
column5: * Indexes down: Dow 0.22%  S&P 500 0.22%  Nasdaq 0.23% (Adds aftermarket moves for Microsoft and Facebook shares)

column4: Microsoft quarterly revenue beats estimates on cloud growth
column5: April 24 Microsoft Corp beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly revenue on Wednesday  fueled by its Azure cloud computing unit and the continued shift to the subscription version of its Office software.

column4: Tesla promises return to profit in third quarter after large loss  may raise more capital
column5: Tesla Inc lost $700 million in the first quarter but predicted it would return to profit in the third quarter as it cuts costs and improves delivery after facing issues ramping up shipments outside the United States.

column4: UPDATE 5-Tesla promises return to profit in Q3 after large loss  may raise more capital
column5: April 24 Tesla Inc lost $700 million in the first quarter but predicted it would return to profit in the third quarter as it cuts costs and improves delivery after facing issues ramping up shipments outside the United States.

column4: Tesla reports first-quarter losses  more to come
column5: April 24 Tesla Inc on Wednesday reported a $700 million loss for the first quarter and said it would also lose money in the second as it struggled to deliver cars to customers and launched a cheaper version of its Model 3 sedan.

column4: Twitter not amused by long wait for Tesla earnings
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Twitter was ablaze on Wednesday with humorous commentary and speculation over why Tesla Inc's first-quarter earnings release was so late. As of 5:05 p.m. ET (2105 GMT)  one hour after the market close  the results still had not been released.

column4: Twitter not amused by long wait for Tesla earnings
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  April 24 Twitter was ablaze on Wednesday with humorous commentary and speculation over why Tesla Inc's first-quarter earnings release was so late. As of 5:05 p.m. ET (2105 GMT)  one hour after the market close  the results still had not been released.

column4: Tesla's Musk says considering building factory in Germany
column5: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk said on Wednesday he was considering building a factory in Germany  responding to a user's suggestion on Twitter.

column4: Tesla's Musk says considering building factory in Germany
column5: April 24 Tesla Inc Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk said on Wednesday he was considering building a factory in Germany  responding to a user's suggestion https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1121114038446858241 on Twitter.

column4: Ford Motor to put $500 million into electric vehicle startup Rivian
column5: Ford Motor Co said on Wednesday it will invest $500 million in U.S. electric vehicle startup Rivian Automotive LLC  joining Amazon.com Inc in backing the potential rival to Silicon Valley's Tesla Inc.

column4: Tesla rival Rivian says Ford Motor invests $500 mln in firm
column5: April 24 U.S. electric pickup truck startup Rivian Automotive LLC said on Wednesday that Ford Motor Co invested $500 million in the company  which is seen as one of the major rivals to Tesla Inc.

column4: Tesla upgrades Model S  X cars  brings backs cheaper variants
column5: Tesla Inc  struggling with delay in delivery of its higher-priced Model S and X luxury cars  said on Tuesday it will bring back lower-priced options for those cars and roll out upgrades to improve their driving range and re-charging speed.
